content.description:
You could consider this one a one move wonder. Easier of you are taller, easiest with a pair of hyperdunks.

Start matched at a good xenolith and hike your feet up and prepare for take off. Launch up to a patina edge about around 5-6 feet up. Pull over and top out. Feet are slightly glassy.

Bring some Redhill.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter
content.location: This line is on the uphill side of the boulder and to the right of the small low roof at obvious xenolith features.

content.description:
Starting at a sidepull-jug on the small roof make a hard move rightward to a slopey flake or a patina edge. From here get your left hand over and use good footwork to reach up to good holds. The top out is the same as for "The Form".

Link it into the dyno if you've got it dialed.

A Stand start at the flake right of the roof goes at around v1.

A left variation with the same sit start is also possible at around v1 or v2.
content.location: This line is located on the backside of the boulder. Start under the small protruding roof.
This route is located on the left side of the boulder (when approaching from downhill) on an overhanging roof.

content.description:
Wills and Mick have this as unnamed.

Sit start at a right facing flake-jug a few feet down and right of the xenolith features. Make a few hard moves up and left past the xenoliths and head up on good patina, or for a more fullfilling tick match the xenolith and fire straight up to the lip.

From the same start you can also head up and right for a fun v3.
content.location: On the backside of the block. When looking downhill at the large face this problem will start slightly left of a plant.
